## Portfolio Website - Full-Stack Content Management System

**A modern, headless CMS-powered portfolio website built with cutting-edge web technologies, demonstrating expertise in full-stack development, content management, and advanced UI/UX design.**

### üöÄ **Technical Architecture & Stack**

_**User (2025-06-04 16:02Z)**_

what is a 405 error:

 POST /api/projects?depth=0&fallback-locale=null 405 in 6ms

---

_**Agent (mode Ask)**_

A **405 error** means "Method Not Allowed". This HTTP status code indicates that the server understands the request, but the specific HTTP method (in this case `POST`) is not supported for the requested resource.

In your case:
```
POST /api/projects?depth=0&fallback-locale=null 405 in 6ms
```

This means:
- You're trying to make a `POST` request to `/api/projects`
- The server is rejecting it because `POST` is not allowed for this endpoint
- The endpoint might only support `GET`, `PUT`, `DELETE`, or other methods, but not `POST`

## Common Causes & Solutions:

1. **Missing API Route Handler**: The `/api/projects` endpoint might not have a `POST` handler defined
2. **Incorrect HTTP Method**: You might need to use `GET` instead of `POST` for fetching projects
3. **Authentication Issues**: The endpoint might require authentication before allowing `POST` requests
4. **Payload CMS Configuration**: Since you're using Payload CMS, the projects collection might not have `create` permissions configured properly

## To Debug This:

---

| File |
|------|
| `d:\Portfolio\src\app\(payload)\api\projects\route.ts` |

</details>
</tool-use>

---

<tool-use data-tool-type="read" data-tool-name="read_file">
<details><summary>Tool use: **read_file** ‚Ä¢ Read file: src/app/(payload)/api/projects/route.ts</summary>

</details>
</tool-use>

---

**Found the issue!** 

Your `/api/projects` route only has a `GET` handler defined, but you're trying to make a `POST` request to it. The route file only exports a `GET` function, which is why you're getting a 405 "Method Not Allowed" error.

## Solutions:

### Option 1: Use GET instead of POST
If you're trying to fetch projects, use a `GET` request:
```typescript
// Instead of POST
const response = await fetch('/api/projects', { method: 'POST' });

// Use GET
const response = await fetch('/api/projects');
```

### Option 2: Add POST handler (if you need to create projects)
If you need to create new projects via API, add a `POST` handler to the route:

```typescript:src/app/(payload)/api/projects/route.ts
// ... existing code ...

export async function POST(request: Request) {
  try {
    const payload = await getPayload({ config });
    const body = await request.json();

    const result = await payload.create({
      collection: 'projects',
      data: body,
    });

    return NextResponse.json(result);
  } catch (error) {
    console.error('Error creating project:', error);
    return NextResponse.json(
      { error: 'Failed to create project' },
      { status: 500 }
    );
  }
}
```

### Option 3: Use Payload's built-in API
Since you're using Payload CMS, you might want to use Payload's built-in REST API instead:
- `GET /api/projects` - List projects
- `POST /api/projects` - Create project  
- `GET /api/projects/[id]` - Get specific project
- `PATCH /api/projects/[id]` - Update project
- `DELETE /api/projects/[id]` - Delete project

The built-in Payload API should automatically handle all HTTP methods based on your collection configuration and access controls.

<tool-use data-tool-type="read" data-tool-name="read_file">
<details><summary>Tool use: **read_file** ‚Ä¢ Read file: src/app/(payload)/api/[...slug]/route.ts</summary>

</details>
</tool-use>

---

Now I see the issue! You have **two conflicting API routes** for projects:

1. **Custom route**: `src/app/(payload)/api/projects/route.ts` (only handles GET)
2. **Payload's built-in route**: `src/app/(payload)/api/[...slug]/route.ts` (handles all HTTP methods including POST)

The problem is that Next.js route precedence means your custom `/projects/route.ts` is taking priority over Payload's catch-all `[...slug]/route.ts` route, so when you try to POST to `/api/projects`, it hits your custom route which only supports GET.

## The Solution:

**Delete or rename your custom projects route** since Payload CMS already provides a complete REST API for the projects collection.

You can either:

### Option 1: Delete the custom route (Recommended)
```bash
rm src/app/(payload)/api/projects/route.ts
```

This will let Payload's built-in API handle all project operations (GET, POST, PATCH, DELETE).

### Option 2: Rename it to avoid conflicts
If you need the custom logic in your GET handler, rename it to something like:
```
src/app/(payload)/api/projects-custom/route.ts
```

## Why this happened:
- You likely created the custom `/projects/route.ts` for some specific GET functionality
- But this inadvertently blocked Payload's built-in POST endpoint for creating projects
- Previously, you might have been creating projects through the Payload admin panel (which uses different routes) or the issue wasn't apparent

After removing the conflicting route, your project uploads should work normally again through Payload's built-in REST API.

It supports all CRUD operations and is equipped with automatic pagination, depth, and sorting. All Payload API routes are mounted and prefixed to your config's `routes.api` URL segment (default: `/api`).<br/><br/>**REST query parameters:**<br/><br/>* depth \- automatically populates relationships and uploads<br/>* locale \- retrieves document(s) in a specific locale<br/>* fallback-locale \- specifies a fallback locale if no locale value exists<br/>* select \- specifies which fields to include to the result<br/>* populate \- specifies which fields to include to the result from populated documents<br/>* limit \- limits the number of documents returned<br/>* page \- specifies which page to get documents from when used with a limit<br/>* sort \- specifies the field(s) to use to sort the returned documents by<br/>* where \- specifies advanced filters to use to query documents<br/>* joins \- specifies the custom request for each join field by name of the field<br/>Collections<br/><br/>Each collection is mounted using its `slug` value. For example, if a collection's slug is `users`, all corresponding routes will be mounted on `/api/users`.<br/><br/>Note: Collection slugs must be formatted in kebab-case<br/><br/>**All CRUD operations are exposed as follows:**<br/><br/>\| Operation    \| Method \| Path                         \| View \|<br/>\| ------------ \| ------ \| ---------------------------- \| ---- \|<br/>\| Find         \| GET    \| /api/\{collection-slug\}       \|      \|<br/>\| Find By ID   \| GET    \| /api/\{collection-slug\}/\{id\}  \|      \|<br/>\| Count        \| GET    \| /api/\{collection-slug\}/count \|      \|<br/>\| Create       \| POST   \| /api/\{collection-slug\}       \|      \|<br/>\| Update       \| PATCH  \| /api/\{collection-slug\}       \|      \|<br/>\| Update By ID \| PATCH  \| /api/\{collection-slug\}/\{id\}  \|      \|<br/>\| Delete       \| DELETE \| /api/\{collection-slug\}       \|      \|<br/>\| Delete by ID \| DELETE \| /api/\{collection-slug\}/\{id\}  \|      \|<br/><br/>Auth Operations<br/><br/>Auth enabled collections are also given the following endpoints:<br/><br/>\| Operation       \| Method \| Path                                   \| View \|<br/>\| --------------- \| ------ \| -------------------------------------- \| ---- \|<br/>\| Login           \| POST   \| /api/\{user-collection\}/login           \|      \|<br/>\| Logout          \| POST /api/\{user-collection\}/reset-password  \|      \|<br/><br/>Globals<br/><br/>Globals cannot be created or deleted, so there are only two REST endpoints opened:<br/><br/>\| Operation     \| Method \| Path                       \| View \|<br/>\| ------------- \| ------ \| -------------------------- \| ---- \|<br/>\| Get Global    \| GET    \| /api/globals/\{global-slug\} \|      \|<br/>\| Update Global \| POST   \| /api/globals/\{global-slug\} \|      \|<br/><br/>Preferences<br/><br/>In addition to the dynamically generated endpoints above Payload also has REST endpoints to manage the admin user preferences for data specific to the authenticated user.<br/><br/>\| Operation         \| Method \| Path                           \| View \|<br/>\| ----------------- \| ------ \| ------------------------------ \| ---- \|<br/>\| Get Preference    \| GET    \| /api/payload-preferences/\{key\} \|      \|<br/>\| Create Preference \| POST   \| /api/payload-preferences/\{key\} \|      \|<br/>\| Delete Preference \| DELETE \| /api/payload-preferences/\{key\} \|      \|<br/><br/>Custom Endpoints<br/><br/>Additional REST API endpoints can be added to your application by providing an array of `endpoints` in various places within a Payload Config. Custom endpoints are useful for adding additional middleware on existing routes or for building custom functionality into Payload apps and plugins. Endpoints can be added at the top of the Payload Config, `collections`, and `globals` and accessed respective of the api and slugs you have configured.<br/><br/>Custom endpoints are not authenticated by default. You are responsible for securing your own endpoints.<br/><br/>Each endpoint object needs to have:<br/><br/>\| Property    \| Description                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        \|<br/>\| ----------- \| -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- \|<br/>\| **path**    \| A string for the endpoint route after the collection or globals slug                                                                                                                                                                               \|<br/>\| **method**  \| The lowercase HTTP verb to use: 'get', 'head', 'post', 'put', 'delete', 'connect' or 'options'                                                                                                                                                     \|<br/>\| **handler** \| A function that accepts **req** \- PayloadRequest object which contains [Web Request](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Request) properties, currently authenticated user and the Local API instance payload.                       \|<br/>\| **root**    \| When true, defines the endpoint on the root Next.js app, bypassing Payload handlers and the routes.api subpath. Note: this only applies to top-level endpoints of your Payload Config, endpoints defined on collections or globals cannot be root. \|<br/>\| **custom**  \| Extension point for adding custom data (e.g. for plugins)                                                                                                                                                                                          \|<br/><br/>Example:<br/><br/>1<br/><br/>import type \{ CollectionConfig \} from 'payload'<br/><br/>2<br/><br/>3<br/><br/>// a collection of 'orders' with an additional route for tracking details, reachable at /api/orders/:id/tracking<br/><br/>4<br/><br/>export const Orders: CollectionConfig \= \{<br/><br/>5<br/><br/> slug: 'orders',<br/><br/>6<br/><br/> fields: \[<br/><br/>7<br/><br/>/\* ... \*/<br/><br/>8<br/><br/>\],<br/><br/>9<br/><br/> endpoints: \[<br/><br/>10<br/><br/>\{<br/><br/>11<br/><br/> path: '/:id/tracking',<br/><br/>12<br/><br/> method: 'get',<br/><br/>13<br/><br/>handler: async (req) \=> \{<br/><br/>14<br/><br/>const tracking \= await getTrackingInfo(req.routeParams.id)<br/><br/>15<br/><br/>16<br/><br/>if (!tracking) \{<br/><br/>17<br/><br/>return Response.json(\{ error: 'not found' \}, \{ status: 404 \})<br/><br/>18<br/><br/>\}<br/><br/>19<br/><br/>20<br/><br/>return Response.json(\{<br/><br/>21<br/><br/> message: \`Hello $\{req.routeParams.name as string\} @ $\{req.routeParams.group as string\}\`,<br/><br/>22<br/><br/>\})<br/><br/>23<br/><br/>\},<br/><br/>24<br/><br/>\},<br/><br/>25<br/><br/>\{<br/><br/>26<br/><br/> path: '/:id/tracking',<br/><br/>27<br/><br/> method: 'post',<br/><br/>28<br/><br/>handler: async (req) \=> \{<br/><br/>29<br/><br/>// \`data\` is not automatically appended to the request<br/><br/>30<br/><br/>// if you would like to read the body of the request<br/><br/>31<br/><br/>// you can use \`data = await req.json()\`<br/><br/>32<br/><br/>const data \= await req.json()<br/><br/>33<br/><br/>await req.payload.update(\{<br/><br/>34<br/><br/> collection: 'tracking',<br/><br/>35<br/><br/> data: \{<br/><br/>36<br/><br/>// data to update the document with<br/><br/>37<br/><br/>\},<br/><br/>38<br/><br/>\})<br/><br/>39<br/><br/>return Response.json(\{<br/><br/>40<br/><br/> message: 'successfully updated tracking info',<br/><br/>41<br/><br/>\})<br/><br/>42<br/><br/>\},<br/><br/>43<br/><br/>\},<br/><br/>44<br/><br/>\{<br/><br/>45<br/><br/> path: '/:id/forbidden',<br/><br/>46<br/><br/> method: 'post',<br/><br/>47<br/><br/>handler: async (req) \=> \{<br/><br/>48<br/><br/>// this is an example of an authenticated endpoint<br/><br/>49<br/><br/>if (!req.user) \{<br/><br/>50<br/><br/>return Response.json(\{ error: 'forbidden' \}, \{ status: 403 \})<br/><br/>51<br/><br/>\}<br/><br/>52<br/><br/>53<br/><br/>// do something<br/><br/>54<br/><br/>55<br/><br/>return Response.json(\{<br/><br/>56<br/><br/> message: 'successfully updated tracking info',<br/><br/>57<br/><br/>\})<br/><br/>58<br/><br/>\},<br/><br/>59<br/><br/>\},<br/><br/>60<br/><br/>\],<br/><br/>61<br/><br/>\}<br/><br/>**Note:** **req** will have the **payload** object and can be used inside your endpoint handlers for making calls like req.payload.find() that will make use of Access Control and Hooks.<br/><br/>Helpful tips<br/><br/>`req.data`<br/><br/>Data is not automatically appended to the request. You can read the body data by calling `await req.json()`.<br/><br/>Or you could use our helper function that mutates the request and appends data and file if found.<br/><br/>1<br/><br/>import \{ addDataAndFileToRequest \} from 'payload'<br/><br/>2<br/><br/>3<br/><br/>// custom endpoint example<br/><br/>4<br/><br/>\{<br/><br/>5<br/><br/> path: '/:id/tracking',<br/><br/>6<br/><br/> method: 'post',<br/><br/>7<br/><br/>handler: async (req) \=> \{<br/><br/>8<br/><br/>await addDataAndFileToRequest(req)<br/><br/>9<br/><br/>await req.payload.update(\{<br/><br/>10<br/><br/> collection: 'tracking',<br/><br/>11<br/><br/> data: \{<br/><br/>12<br/><br/>// data to update the document with<br/><br/>13<br/><br/>\}<br/><br/>14<br/><br/>\})<br/><br/>15<br/><br/>return Response.json(\{<br/><br/>16<br/><br/> message: 'successfully updated tracking info'<br/><br/>17<br/><br/>\})<br/><br/>18<br/><br/>\}<br/><br/>19<br/><br/>\}<br/><br/>`req.locale` & `req.fallbackLocale`<br/><br/>The locale and the fallback locale are not automatically appended to custom endpoint requests. If you would like to add them you can use this helper function.<br/><br/>1<br/><br/>import \{ addLocalesToRequestFromData \} from 'payload'<br/><br/>2<br/><br/>3<br/><br/>// custom endpoint example<br/><br/>4<br/><br/>\{<br/><br/>5<br/><br/> path: '/:id/tracking',<br/><br/>6<br/><br/> method: 'post',<br/><br/>7<br/><br/>handler: async (req) \=> \{<br/><br/>8<br/><br/>await addLocalesToRequestFromData(req)<br/><br/>9<br/><br/>// you now can access req.locale & req.fallbackLocale<br/><br/>10<br/><br/>return Response.json(\{ message: 'success' \})<br/><br/>11<br/><br/>\}<br/><br/>12<br/><br/>\}<br/><br/>`headersWithCors`<br/><br/>By default, custom endpoints don't handle CORS headers in responses. The `headersWithCors` function checks the Payload config and sets the appropriate CORS headers in the response accordingly.<br/><br/>1<br/><br/>import \{ headersWithCors \} from 'payload'<br/><br/>2<br/><br/>3<br/><br/>// custom endpoint example<br/><br/>4<br/><br/>\{<br/><br/>5<br/><br/> path: '/:id/tracking',<br/><br/>6<br/><br/> method: 'post',<br/><br/>7<br/><br/>handler: async (req) \=> \{<br/><br/>8<br/><br/>return Response.json(<br/><br/>9<br/><br/>\{ message: 'success' \},<br/><br/>10<br/><br/>\{<br/><br/>11<br/><br/> headers: headersWithCors(\{<br/><br/>12<br/><br/> headers: new Headers(),<br/><br/>13<br/><br/> req,<br/><br/>14<br/><br/>\})<br/><br/>15<br/><br/>\},<br/><br/>16<br/><br/>)<br/><br/>17<br/><br/>\}<br/><br/>18<br/><br/>\}<br/><br/>Method Override for GET Requests<br/><br/>Payload supports a method override feature that allows you to send GET requests using the HTTP POST method. This can be particularly useful in scenarios when the query string in a regular GET request is too long.<br/><br/>How to Use<br/><br/>To use this feature, include the `X-HTTP-Method-Override` header set to `GET` in your POST request. The parameters should be sent in the body of the request with the `Content-Type` set to `application/x-www-form-urlencoded`.<br/><br/>Example<br/><br/>Here is an example of how to use the method override to perform a GET request:<br/><br/>Using Method Override (POST)<br/><br/>1<br/><br/>const res \= await fetch(\`$\{api\}/$\{collectionSlug\}\`, \{<br/><br/>2<br/><br/> method: 'POST',<br/><br/>3<br/><br/> credentials: 'include',<br/><br/>4<br/><br/> headers: \{<br/><br/>5<br/><br/>'Accept-Language': i18n.language,<br/><br/>6<br/><br/>'Content-Type': 'application/x-www-form-urlencoded',<br/><br/>7<br/><br/>'X-HTTP-Method-Override': 'GET',<br/><br/>8<br/><br/>\},<br/><br/>9<br/><br/> body: qs.stringify(\{<br/><br/>10<br/><br/> depth: 1,<br/><br/>11<br/><br/> locale: 'en',<br/><br/>12<br/><br/>\}),<br/><br/>13<br/><br/>\})<br/><br/>Equivalent Regular GET Request<br/><br/>1<br/><br/>const res \= await fetch(\`$\{api\}/$\{collectionSlug\}?depth=1&locale=en\`, \{<br/><br/>2<br/><br/> method: 'GET',<br/><br/>3<br/><br/> credentials: 'include',<br/><br/>4<br/><br/> headers: \{<br/><br/>5<br/><br/>'Accept-Language': i18n.language,<br/><br/>6<br/><br/>\},<br/><br/>7<br/><br/>\})<br/><br/>Next GraphQL Overview<br/><br/>###### On this page<br/><br/>* Collections<br/>* Auth Operations<br/>* Globals<br/>* Preferences<br/>* Custom Endpoints<br/>* Method Override for GET Requests<br/>* How to Use<br/>* Example<br/><br/>Star on GitHubStarChat on DiscordDiscord online<br/><br/>Edit this page on GitHub <br/><br/>Use Cases<br/><br/>Content Management SystemEnterprise App BuilderHeadless E-CommerceDigital Asset Management<br/><br/>Developers<br/><br/>Payload CloudDocumentationCommunity HelpRoadmapTemplatesReleases<br/><br/>Company<br/><br/>PricingEnterpriseCase StudiesPartner With UsFind a PartnerBlogSecurityCompare PayloadTerms of ServicePrivacy PolicyContact<br/><br/>Stay connected<br/><br/>Subscribe to our newsletterSubmit<br/><br/>Switch themesAutoLightDark |
| Collection Configs \| Documentation | https://payloadcms.com/docs/configuration/collections | Product<br/><br/>Simplify your stack and build anything. Or everything.<br/><br/>Schedule a Demo<br/><br/>USE CASES<br/><br/>Headless CMSEnterprise App BuilderHeadless E-CommerceDigital Asset Management<br/><br/>FEATURES<br/><br/>Multi-TenancyWhite LabelLocalizationAccess ControlAuth<br/><br/>CASE STUDIES<br/><br/>#### See what others are building with Payload.<br/><br/>Browse Case Studies<br/><br/>Why Payload<br/><br/>Build tomorrow‚Äôs web with a modern solution you truly own.<br/><br/>PAYLOAD IS FOR<br/><br/>DevelopersMarketing teamsEnterprise companiesAgencies & Consultancies<br/><br/>COMPARE PAYLOAD<br/><br/>Payload vs WordPressPayload vs ContentfulPayload vs SanityPayload vs StrapiPayload vs Directus<br/><br/>AGENCY TESTIMONIAL<br/><br/>#### "Payload has transformed the way our clients manage content. It's an indispensable tool for any modern agency."<br/><br/>Become a PartnerFind a Partner<br/><br/>Developers<br/><br/>Code-based nature means you can build on top of it to power anything.<br/><br/>Resources<br/><br/>DocumentationExamplesTemplatesGitHubReleasesBlogGuides & Tutorials<br/><br/>Community<br/><br/>RoadmapDiscordCommunity Help<br/><br/>Payload Cloud<br/><br/>#### Deploy your entire stack in one place with Payload Cloud.<br/><br/>LoginCloud Pricing<br/><br/>Enterprise<br/><br/>It‚Äôs time to take back your content infrastructure.<br/><br/>Schedule a Demo<br/><br/>Enterprise Features<br/><br/>SSOAI Auto-EmbeddingPublishing WorkflowsVisual EditorStatic A/B testingAI features<br/><br/>Customer Stories<br/><br/>MicrosoftASICSBlue OriginHello BelloTekton<br/><br/>Featured Customer Story<br/><br/>#### Microsoft chose Payload to tell the world about AI.<br/><br/>Read the case studyBrowse all<br/><br/>Docs<br/><br/>LoginGet Started<br/><br/>Search<br/><br/>Search<br/><br/># Collection Configs<br/><br/>A Collection is a group of records, called Documents, that all share a common schema. You can define as many Collections as your application needs. Each Document in a Collection is stored in the Database based on the Fields that you define, and automatically generates a Local API, REST API, and GraphQL API used to manage your Documents.<br/><br/>Collections are also used to achieve Authentication in Payload. By defining a Collection with `auth` options, that Collection receives additional operations to support user authentication.<br/><br/>Collections are the primary way to structure recurring data in your application, such as users, products, pages, posts, and other types of content that you might want to manage. Each Collection can have its own unique Access Control, Hooks, Admin Options, and more.<br/><br/>To define a Collection Config, use the `collection` property in your Payload Config:<br/><br/>1<br/><br/>import \{ buildConfig \} from 'payload'<br/><br/>2<br/><br/>3<br/><br/>export default buildConfig(\{<br/><br/>4<br/><br/>// ...<br/><br/>5<br/><br/> collections: \[<br/><br/>6<br/><br/>7<br/><br/>// Your Collections go here<br/><br/>8<br/><br/>\],<br/><br/>9<br/><br/>\})<br/><br/>**Tip:** If your Collection is only ever meant to contain a single Document, consider using a Global instead.<br/><br/>Config Options<br/><br/>It's often best practice to write your Collections in separate files and then import them into the main Payload Config.<br/><br/>Here is what a simple Collection Config might look like:<br/><br/>1<br/><br/>import type \{ CollectionConfig \} from 'payload'<br/><br/>2<br/><br/>3<br/><br/>export const Posts: CollectionConfig \= \{<br/><br/>4<br/><br/> slug: 'posts',<br/><br/>5<br/><br/> fields: \[<br/><br/>6<br/><br/>\{<br/><br/>7<br/><br/> name: 'title',<br/><br/>8<br/><br/> type: 'text',<br/><br/>9<br/><br/>\},<br/><br/>10<br/><br/>\],<br/><br/>11<br/><br/>\}<br/><br/>**Reminder:** For more complex examples, see the Templates and Examples directories in the Payload repository.<br/><br/>The following options are available:<br/><br/>\| Option             \| Description                                                                                                                                                                                                                      \|<br/>\| ------------------ \| -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- \|<br/>\| admin              \| The configuration options for the Admin Panel. [More details](#admin-options).                                                                                                                                                   \|<br/>\| access             \| Provide Access Control functions to define exactly who should be able to do what with Documents in this Collection. [More details](../access-control/collections).                                                               \|<br/>\| auth               \| Specify options if you would like this Collection to feature authentication. [More details](../authentication/overview).                                                                                                         \|<br/>\| custom             \| Extension point for adding custom data (e.g. for plugins)                                                                                                                                                                        \|<br/>\| disableDuplicate   \| When true, do not show the "Duplicate" button while editing documents within this Collection and prevent duplicate from all APIs.                                                                                                \|<br/>\| defaultSort        \| Pass a top-level field to sort by default in the Collection List View. Prefix the name of the field with a minus symbol ("-") to sort in descending order. Multiple fields can be specified by using a string array.             \|<br/>\| dbName             \| Custom table or Collection name depending on the Database Adapter. Auto-generated from slug if not defined.                                                                                                                      \|<br/>\| endpoints          \| Add custom routes to the REST API. Set to false to disable routes. [More details](../rest-api/overview#custom-endpoints).                                                                                                        \|<br/>\| fields \*          \| Array of field types that will determine the structure and functionality of the data stored within this Collection. [More details](../fields/overview).                                                                          \|<br/>\| graphQL            \| Manage GraphQL-related properties for this collection. [More](#graphql)                                                                                                                                                          \|<br/>\| hooks              \| Entry point for Hooks. [More details](../hooks/overview#collection-hooks).                                                                                                                                                       \|<br/>\| orderable          \| If true, enables custom ordering for the collection, and documents can be reordered via drag and drop. Uses [fractional indexing](https://observablehq.com/@dgreensp/implementing-fractional-indexing) for efficient reordering. \|<br/>\| labels             \| Singular and plural labels for use in identifying this Collection throughout Payload. Auto-generated from slug if not defined.                                                                                                   \|<br/>\| enableQueryPresets \| Enable query presets for this Collection. [More details](../query-presets/overview).                                                                                                                                             \|<br/>\| lockDocuments      \| Enables or disables document locking. By default, document locking is enabled. Set to an object to configure, or set to false to disable locking. [More details](../admin/locked-documents).                                     \|<br/>\| slug \*            \| Unique, URL-friendly string that will act as an identifier for this Collection.                                                                                                                                                  \|<br/>\| timestamps         \| Set to false to disable documents' automatically generated createdAt and updatedAt timestamps.                                                                                                                                   \|<br/>\| typescript         \| An object with property interface as the text used in schema generation. Auto-generated from slug if not defined.                                                                                                                \|<br/>\| upload             \| Specify options if you would like this Collection to support file uploads. For more, consult the [Uploads](../upload/overview) documentation.                                                                                    \|<br/>\| versions           \| Set to true to enable default options, or configure with object properties. [More details](../versions/overview#collection-config).                                                                                              \|<br/>\| defaultPopulate    \| Specify which fields to select when this Collection is populated from another document. [More Details](../queries/select#defaultpopulate-collection-config-property).                                                            \|<br/>\| indexes            \| Define compound indexes for this collection. This can be used to either speed up querying/sorting by 2 or more fields at the same time or to ensure uniqueness between several fields.                                           \|<br/>\| forceSelect        \| Specify which fields should be selected always, regardless of the select query which can be useful that the field exists for access control / hooks                                                                              \|<br/><br/>_\* An asterisk denotes that a property is required._<br/><br/>Fields<br/><br/>Fields define the schema of the Documents within a Collection. To learn more, go to the Fields documentation.<br/><br/>Access Control<br/><br/>Collection Access Control determines what a user can and cannot do with any given Document within a Collection. To learn more, go to the Access Control documentation.<br/><br/>Hooks<br/><br/>Collection Hooks allow you to tie into the lifecycle of your Documents so you can execute your own logic during specific events. To learn more, go to the Hooks documentation.<br/><br/>Admin Options<br/><br/>The behavior of Collections within the Admin Panel can be fully customized to fit the needs of your application. This includes grouping or hiding their navigation links, adding Custom Components, selecting which fields to display in the List View, and more.<br/><br/>To configure Admin Options for Collections, use the `admin` property in your Collection Config:<br/><br/>1<br/><br/>import type \{ CollectionConfig \} from 'payload'<br/><br/>2<br/><br/>3<br/><br/>export const MyCollection: CollectionConfig \= \{<br/><br/>4<br/><br/>// ...<br/><br/>5<br/><br/> admin: \{<br/><br/>6<br/><br/>7<br/><br/>// ...<br/><br/>8<br/><br/>\},<br/><br/>9<br/><br/>\}<br/><br/>The following options are available:<br/><br/>\| Option                     \| Description                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           \|<br/>\| -------------------------- \| ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- \|<br/>\| group                      \| Text or localization object used to group Collection and Global links in the admin navigation. Set to false to hide the link from the navigation while keeping its routes accessible.                                                                 \|<br/>\| hidden                     \| Set to true or a function, called with the current user, returning true to exclude this Collection from navigation and admin routing.                                                                                                                 \|<br/>\| hooks                      \| Admin-specific hooks for this Collection. [More details](../hooks/collections).                                                                                                                                                                       \|<br/>\| useAsTitle                 \| Specify a top-level field to use for a document title throughout the Admin Panel. If no field is defined, the ID of the document is used as the title. A field with virtual: true cannot be used as the title, unless it's linked to a relationship'. \|<br/>\| description                \| Text to display below the Collection label in the List View to give editors more information. Alternatively, you can use the admin.components.Description to render a React component. [More details](#custom-components).                            \|<br/>\| defaultColumns             \| Array of field names that correspond to which columns to show by default in this Collection's List View.                                                                                                                                              \|<br/>\| disableCopyToLocale        \| Disables the "Copy to Locale" button while editing documents within this Collection. Only applicable when localization is enabled.                                                                                                                    \|<br/>\| hideAPIURL                 \| Hides the "API URL" meta field while editing documents within this Collection.                                                                                                                                                                        \|<br/>\| enableRichTextLink         \| The [Rich Text](../fields/rich-text) field features a Link element which allows for users to automatically reference related documents within their rich text. Set to true by default.                                                                \|<br/>\| enableRichTextRelationship \| The [Rich Text](../fields/rich-text) field features a Relationship element which allows for users to automatically reference related documents within their rich text. Set to true by default.                                                        \|<br/>\| folders                    \| A boolean to enable folders for a given collection. Defaults to false. [More details](../folders/overview).                                                                                                                                           \|<br/>\| meta                       \| Page metadata overrides to apply to this Collection within the Admin Panel. [More details](../admin/metadata).                                                                                                                                        \|<br/>\| preview                    \| Function to generate preview URLs within the Admin Panel that can point to your app. [More details](../admin/preview).                                                                                                                                \|<br/>\| livePreview                \| Enable real-time editing for instant visual feedback of your front-end application. [More details](../live-preview/overview).                                                                                                                         \|<br/>\| components                 \| Swap in your own React components to be used within this Collection. [More details](#custom-components).                                                                                                                                              \|<br/>\| listSearchableFields       \| Specify which fields should be searched in the List search view. [More details](#list-searchable-fields).                                                                                                                                             \|<br/>\| pagination                 \| Set pagination-specific options for this Collection. [More details](#pagination).                                                                                                                                                                     \|<br/>\| baseListFilter             \| You can define a default base filter for this collection's List view, which will be merged into any filters that the user performs.                                                                                                                   \|<br/><br/>Custom Components<br/><br/>Collections can set their own Custom Components which only apply to Collection-specific UI within the Admin Panel. This includes elements such as the Save Button, or entire layouts such as the Edit View.<br/><br/>To override Collection Components, use the `admin.components` property in your Collection Config:<br/><br/>1<br/><br/>import type \{ CollectionConfig \} from 'payload'<br/><br/>2<br/><br/>3<br/><br/>export const MyCollection: CollectionConfig \= \{<br/><br/>4<br/><br/>// ...<br/><br/>5<br/><br/> admin: \{<br/><br/>6<br/><br/> components: \{<br/><br/>7<br/><br/>8<br/><br/>// ...<br/><br/>9<br/><br/>\},<br/><br/>10<br/><br/>\},<br/><br/>11<br/><br/>\}<br/><br/>The following options are available:<br/><br/>\| Option          \| Description                                                                                                                                                                      \|<br/>\| --------------- \| -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- \|<br/>\| afterList       \| An array of components to inject _after_ the built-in List View. [More details](../custom-components/list-view#afterlist).                                                       \|<br/>\| afterListTable  \| An array of components to inject _after_ the built-in List View's table. [More details](../custom-components/list-view#afterlisttable).                                          \|<br/>\| beforeList      \| An array of components to inject _before_ the built-in List View. [More details](../custom-components/list-view#beforelist).                                                     \|<br/>\| beforeListTable \| An array of components to inject _before_ the built-in List View's table. [More details](../custom-components/list-view#beforelisttable).                                        \|<br/>\| listMenuItems   \| An array of components to render within a menu next to the List Controls (after the Columns and Filters options)                                                                 \|<br/>\| Description     \| A component to render below the Collection label in the List View. An alternative to the admin.description property. [More details](../custom-components/list-view#description). \|<br/>\| edit            \| Override specific components within the Edit View. [More details](#edit-view-options).                                                                                           \|<br/>\| views           \| Override or create new views within the Admin Panel. [More details](../custom-components/custom-views).                                                                          \|<br/><br/>Edit View Options<br/><br/>1<br/><br/>import type \{ CollectionCOnfig \} from 'payload'<br/><br/>2<br/><br/>3<br/><br/>export const MyCollection: CollectionConfig \= \{<br/><br/>4<br/><br/>// ...<br/><br/>5<br/><br/> admin: \{<br/><br/>6<br/><br/> components: \{<br/><br/>7<br/><br/> edit: \{<br/><br/>8<br/><br/>9<br/><br/>// ...<br/><br/>10<br/><br/>\},<br/><br/>11<br/><br/>\},<br/><br/>12<br/><br/>\},<br/><br/>13<br/><br/>\}<br/><br/>The following options are available:<br/><br/>\| Option          \| Description                                                                                                                                                                                             \|<br/>\| --------------- \| ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- \|<br/>\| SaveButton      \| Replace the default Save Button within the Edit View. [Drafts](../versions/drafts) must be disabled. [More details](../custom-components/edit-view#savebutton).                                         \|<br/>\| SaveDraftButton \| Replace the default Save Draft Button within the Edit View. [Drafts](../versions/drafts) must be enabled and autosave must be disabled. [More details](../custom-components/edit-view#savedraftbutton). \|<br/>\| PublishButton   \| Replace the default Publish Button within the Edit View. [Drafts](../versions/drafts) must be enabled. [More details](../custom-components/edit-view#publishbutton).                                    \|<br/>\| PreviewButton   \| Replace the default Preview Button within the Edit View. [Preview](../admin/preview) must be enabled. [More details](../custom-components/edit-view#previewbutton).                                     \|<br/>\| Upload          \| Replace the default Upload component within the Edit View. [Upload](../upload/overview) must be enabled. [More details](../custom-components/edit-view#upload).                                         \|<br/><br/>**Note:** For details on how to build Custom Components, see Building Custom Components.<br/><br/>Pagination<br/><br/>All Collections receive their own List View which displays a paginated list of documents that can be sorted and filtered. The pagination behavior of the List View can be customized on a per-Collection basis, and uses the same Pagination API that Payload provides.<br/><br/>To configure pagination options, use the `admin.pagination` property in your Collection Config:<br/><br/>1<br/><br/>import type \{ CollectionConfig \} from 'payload'<br/><br/>2<br/><br/>3<br/><br/>export const Posts: CollectionConfig \= \{<br/><br/>4<br/><br/>// ...<br/><br/>5<br/><br/> admin: \{<br/><br/>6<br/><br/> pagination: \{<br/><br/>7<br/><br/> defaultLimit: 10,<br/><br/>8<br/><br/> limits: \[10, 20, 50\],<br/><br/>9<br/><br/>\},<br/><br/>10<br/><br/>\},<br/><br/>11<br/><br/>\}<br/><br/>The following options are available:<br/><br/>\| Option       \| Description                                                                                         \|<br/>\| ------------ \| --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- \|<br/>\| defaultLimit \| Integer that specifies the default per-page limit that should be used. Defaults to 10\.             \|<br/>\| limits       \| Provide an array of integers to use as per-page options for admins to choose from in the List View. \|<br/><br/>List Searchable Fields<br/><br/>In the List View, there is a "search" box that allows you to quickly find a document through a simple text search. By default, it searches on the ID field. If defined, the `admin.useAsTitle` field is used. Or, you can explicitly define which fields to search based on the needs of your application.<br/><br/>To define which fields should be searched, use the `admin.listSearchableFields` property in your Collection Config:<br/><br/>1<br/><br/>import type \{ CollectionConfig \} from 'payload'<br/><br/>2<br/><br/>3<br/><br/>export const Posts: CollectionConfig \= \{<br/><br/>4<br/><br/>// ...<br/><br/>5<br/><br/> admin: \{<br/><br/>6<br/><br/> listSearchableFields: \['title', 'slug'\],<br/><br/>7<br/><br/>\},<br/><br/>8<br/><br/>\}<br/><br/>**Tip:** If you are adding `listSearchableFields`, make sure you index each of these fields so your admin queries can remain performant.<br/><br/>GraphQL<br/><br/>You can completely disable GraphQL for this collection by passing `graphQL: false` to your collection config. This will completely disable all queries, mutations, and types from appearing in your GraphQL schema.<br/><br/>You can also pass an object to the collection's `graphQL` property, which allows you to define the following properties:<br/><br/>\| Option           \| Description                                                                       \|<br/>\| ---------------- \| --------------------------------------------------------------------------------- \|<br/>\| singularName     \| Override the "singular" name that will be used in GraphQL schema generation.      \|<br/>\| pluralName       \| Override the "plural" name that will be used in GraphQL schema generation.        \|<br/>\| disableQueries   \| Disable all GraphQL queries that correspond to this collection by passing true.   \|<br/>\| disableMutations \| Disable all GraphQL mutations that correspond to this collection by passing true. \|<br/><br/>TypeScript<br/><br/>You can import types from Payload to help make writing your Collection configs easier and type-safe. There are two main types that represent the Collection Config, `CollectionConfig` and `SanitizeCollectionConfig`.<br/><br/>The `CollectionConfig` type represents a raw Collection Config in its full form, where only the bare minimum properties are marked as required. The `SanitizedCollectionConfig` type represents a Collection Config after it has been fully sanitized. Generally, this is only used internally by Payload.<br/><br/>1<br/><br/>import type \{ CollectionConfig, SanitizedCollectionConfig \} from 'payload'<br/><br/>Next Global Configs<br/><br/>###### On this page<br/><br/>* Config Options<br/>* Fields<br/>* Access Control<br/>* Hooks<br/>* Admin Options<br/>* Custom Components<br/>* Pagination<br/>* List Searchable Fields<br/>* GraphQL<br/>* TypeScript<br/><br/>Star on GitHubStarChat on DiscordDiscord online<br/><br/>Edit this page on GitHub <br/><br/>Use Cases<br/><br/>Content Management SystemEnterprise App BuilderHeadless E-CommerceDigital Asset Management<br/><br/>Developers<br/><br/>Payload CloudDocumentationCommunity HelpRoadmapTemplatesReleases<br/><br/>Company<br/><br/>PricingEnterpriseCase StudiesPartner With UsFind a PartnerBlogSecurityCompare PayloadTerms of ServicePrivacy PolicyContact<br/><br/>Stay connected<br/><br/>Subscribe to our newsletterSubmit<br/><br/>Switch themesAutoLightDark |

| REST API \| Documentation \| Payload | https://payloadcms.com/docs/rest-api/overview | Product<br/><br/>Simplify your stack and build anything. Or everything.<br/><br/>Schedule a Demo<br/><br/>USE CASES<br/><br/>Headless CMSEnterprise App BuilderHeadless E-CommerceDigital Asset Management<br/><br/>FEATURES<br/><br/>Multi-TenancyWhite LabelLocalizationAccess ControlAuth<br/><br/>CASE STUDIES<br/><br/>#### See what others are building with Payload.<br/><br/>Browse Case Studies<br/><br/>Why Payload<br/><br/>Build tomorrow‚Äôs web with a modern solution you truly own.<br/><br/>PAYLOAD IS FOR<br/><br/>DevelopersMarketing teamsEnterprise companiesAgencies & Consultancies<br/><br/>COMPARE PAYLOAD<br/><br/>Payload vs WordPressPayload vs ContentfulPayload vs SanityPayload vs StrapiPayload vs Directus<br/><br/>AGENCY TESTIMONIAL<br/><br/>#### "Payload has transformed the way our clients manage content. It's an indispensable tool for any modern agency."<br/><br/>Become a PartnerFind a Partner<br/><br/>Developers<br/><br/>Code-based nature means you can build on top of it to power anything.<br/><br/>Resources<br/><br/>DocumentationExamplesTemplatesGitHubReleasesBlogGuides & Tutorials<br/><br/>Community<br/><br/>RoadmapDiscordCommunity Help<br/><br/>Payload Cloud<br/><br/>#### Deploy your entire stack in one place with Payload Cloud.<br/><br/>LoginCloud Pricing<br/><br/>Enterprise<br/><br/>It‚Äôs time to take back your content infrastructure.<br/><br/>Schedule a Demo<br/><br/>Enterprise Features<br/><br/>SSOAI Auto-EmbeddingPublishing WorkflowsVisual EditorStatic A/B testingAI features<br/><br/>Customer Stories<br/><br/>MicrosoftASICSBlue OriginHello BelloTekton<br/><br/>Featured Customer Story<br/><br/>#### Microsoft chose Payload to tell the world about AI.<br/><br/>Read the case studyBrowse all<br/><br/>Docs<br/><br/>LoginGet Started<br/><br/>Search<br/><br/>Search<br/><br/># REST API<br/><br/>A fully functional REST API is automatically generated from your Collection and Global configs.<br/><br/>The REST API is a fully functional HTTP client that allows you to interact with your Documents in a RESTful manner. It supports all CRUD operations and is equipped with automatic pagination, depth, and sorting. All Payload API routes are mounted and prefixed to your config's `routes.api` URL segment (default: `/api`).<br/><br/>**REST query parameters:**<br/><br/>* depth \- automatically populates relationships and uploads<br/>* locale \- retrieves document(s) in a specific locale<br/>* fallback-locale \- specifies a fallback locale if no locale value exists<br/>* select \- specifies which fields to include to the result<br/>* populate \- specifies which fields to include to the result from populated documents<br/>* limit \- limits the number of documents returned<br/>* page \- specifies which page to get documents from when used with a limit<br/>* sort \- specifies the field(s) to use to sort the returned documents by<br/>* where \- specifies advanced filters to use to query documents<br/>* joins \- specifies the custom request for each join field by name of the field<br/>Collections<br/><br/>Each collection is mounted using its `slug` value. For example, if a collection's slug is `users`, all corresponding routes will be mounted on `/api/users`.<br/><br/>Note: Collection slugs must be formatted in kebab-case<br/><br/>**All CRUD operations are exposed as follows:**<br/><br/>\| Operation    \| Method \| Path                         \| View \|<br/>\| ------------ \| ------ \| ---------------------------- \| ---- \|<br/>\| Find         \| GET    \| /api/\{collection-slug\}       \|      \|<br/>\| Find By ID   \| GET    \| /api/\{collection-slug\}/\{id\}  \|      \|<br/>\| Count        \| GET    \| /api/\{collection-slug\}/count \|      \|<br/>\| Create       \| POST   \| /api/\{collection-slug\}       \|      \|<br/>\| Update       \| PATCH  \| /api/\{collection-slug\}       \|      \|<br/>\| Update By ID \| PATCH  \| /api/\{collection-slug\}/\{id\}  \|      \|<br/>\| Delete       \| DELETE \| /api/\{collection-slug\}       \|      \|<br/>\| Delete by ID \| DELETE \| /api/\{collection-slug\}/\{id\}  \|      \|<br/><br/>Auth Operations<br/><br/>Auth enabled collections are also given the following endpoints:<br/><br/>\| Operation       \| Method \| Path                                   \| View \|<br/>\| --------------- \| ------ \| -------------------------------------- \| ---- \|<br/>\| Login           \| POST   \| /api/\{user-collection\}/login           \|      \|<br/>\| Logout          \| POST   \| /api/\{user-collection\}/logout          \|      \|<br/>\| Unlock          \| POST   \| /api/\{user-collection\}/unlock          \|      \|<br/>\| Refresh         \| POST   \| /api/\{user-collection\}/refresh-token   \|      \|<br/>\| Verify User     \| POST   \| /api/\{user-collection\}/verify/\{token\}  \|      \|<br/>\| Current User    \| GET    \| /api/\{user-collection\}/me              \|      \|<br/>\| Forgot Password \| POST   \| /api/\{user-collection\}/forgot-password \|      \|<br/>\| Reset Password  \| POST   \| /api/\{user-collection\}/reset-password  \|      \|<br/><br/>Globals<br/><br/>Globals cannot be created or deleted, so there are only two REST endpoints opened:<br/><br/>\| Operation     \| Method \| Path                       \| View \|<br/>\| ------------- \| ------ \| -------------------------- \| ---- \|<br/>\| Get Global    \| GET    \| /api/globals/\{global-slug\} \|      \|<br/>\| Update Global \| POST   \| /api/globals/\{global-slug\} \|      \|<br/><br/>Preferences<br/><br/>In addition to the dynamically generated endpoints above Payload also has REST endpoints to manage the admin user preferences for data specific to the authenticated user.<br/><br/>\| Operation         \| Method \| Path                           \| View \|<br/>\| ----------------- \| ------ \| ------------------------------ \| ---- \|<br/>\| Get Preference    \| GET    \| /api/payload-preferences/\{key\} \|      \|<br/>\| Create Preference \| POST   \| /api/payload-preferences/\{key\} \|      \|<br/>\| Delete Preference \| DELETE \| /api/payload-preferences/\{key\} \|      \|<br/><br/>Custom Endpoints<br/><br/>Additional REST API endpoints can be added to your application by providing an array of `endpoints` in various places within a Payload Config. Custom endpoints are useful for adding additional middleware on existing routes or for building custom functionality into Payload apps and plugins. Endpoints can be added at the top of the Payload Config, `collections`, and `globals` and accessed respective of the api and slugs you have configured.<br/><br/>Custom endpoints are not authenticated by default. You are responsible for securing your own endpoints.<br/><br/>Each endpoint object needs to have:<br/><br/>\| Property    \| Description                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        \|<br/>\| ----------- \| -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- \|<br/>\| **path**    \| A string for the endpoint route after the collection or globals slug                                                                                                                                                                               \|<br/>\| **method**  \| The lowercase HTTP verb to use: 'get', 'head', 'post', 'put', 'delete', 'connect' or 'options'                                                                                                                                                     \|<br/>\| **handler** \| A function that accepts **req** \- PayloadRequest object which contains [Web Request](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Request) properties, currently authenticated user and the Local API instance payload.                       \|<br/>\| **root**    \| When true, defines the endpoint on the root Next.js app, bypassing Payload handlers and the routes.api subpath. Note: this only applies to top-level endpoints of your Payload Config, endpoints defined on collections or globals cannot be root. \|<br/>\| **custom**  \| Extension point for adding custom data (e.g. for plugins)                                                                                                                                                                                          \|<br/><br/>Example:<br/><br/>1<br/><br/>import type \{ CollectionConfig \} from 'payload'<br/><br/>2<br/><br/>3<br/><br/>// a collection of 'orders' with an additional route for tracking details, reachable at /api/orders/:id/tracking<br/><br/>4<br/><br/>export const Orders: CollectionConfig \= \{<br/><br/>5<br/><br/> slug: 'orders',<br/><br/>6<br/><br/> fields: \[<br/><br/>7<br/><br/>/\* ... \*/<br/><br/>8<br/><br/>\],<br/><br/>9<br/><br/> endpoints: \[<br/><br/>10<br/><br/>\{<br/><br/>11<br/><br/> path: '/:id/tracking',<br/><br/>12<br/><br/> method: 'get',<br/><br/>13<br/><br/>handler: async (req) \=> \{<br/><br/>14<br/><br/>const tracking \= await getTrackingInfo(req.routeParams.id)<br/><br/>15<br/><br/>16<br/><br/>if (!tracking) \{<br/><br/>17<br/><br/>return Response.json(\{ error: 'not found' \}, \{ status: 404 \})<br/><br/>18<br/><br/>\}<br/><br/>19<br/><br/>20<br/><br/>return Response.json(\{<br/><br/>21<br/><br/> message: \`Hello $\{req.routeParams.name as string\} @ $\{req.routeParams.group as string\}\`,<br/><br/>22<br/><br/>\})<br/><br/>23<br/><br/>\},<br/><br/>24<br/><br/>\},<br/><br/>25<br/><br/>\{<br/><br/>26<br/><br/> path: '/:id/tracking',<br/><br/>27<br/><br/> method: 'post',<br/><br/>28<br/><br/>handler: async (req) \=> \{<br/><br/>29<br/><br/>// \`data\` is not automatically appended to the request<br/><br/>30<br/><br/>// if you would like to read the body of the request<br/><br/>31<br/><br/>// you can use \`data = await req.json()\`<br/><br/>32<br/><br/>const data \= await req.json()<br/><br/>33<br/><br/>await req.payload.update(\{<br/><br/>34<br/><br/> collection: 'tracking',<br/><br/>35<br/><br/> data: \{<br/><br/>36<br/><br/>// data to update the document with<br/><br/>37<br/><br/>\},<br/><br/>38<br/><br/>\})<br/><br/>39<br/><br/>return Response.json(\{<br/><br/>40<br/><br/> message: 'successfully updated tracking info',<br/><br/>41<br/><br/>\})<br/><br/>42<br/><br/>\},<br/><br/>43<br/><br/>\},<br/><br/>44<br/><br/>\{<br/><br/>45<br/><br/> path: '/:id/forbidden',<br/><br/>46<br/><br/> method: 'post',<br/><br/>47<br/><br/>handler: async (req) \=> \{<br/><br/>48<br/><br/>// this is an example of an authenticated endpoint<br/><br/>49<br/><br/>if (!req.user) \{<br/><br/>50<br/><br/>return Response.json(\{ error: 'forbidden' \}, \{ status: 403 \})<br/><br/>51<br/><br/>\}<br/><br/>52<br/><br/>53<br/><br/>// do something<br/><br/>54<br/><br/>55<br/><br/>return Response.json(\{<br/><br/>56<br/><br/> message: 'successfully updated tracking info',<br/><br/>57<br/><br/>\})<br/><br/>58<br/><br/>\},<br/><br/>59<br/><br/>\},<br/><br/>60<br/><br/>\],<br/><br/>61<br/><br/>\}<br/><br/>**Note:** **req** will have the **payload** object and can be used inside your endpoint handlers for making calls like req.payload.find() that will make use of Access Control and Hooks.<br/><br/>Helpful tips<br/><br/>`req.data`<br/><br/>Data is not automatically appended to the request. You can read the body data by calling `await req.json()`.<br/><br/>Or you could use our helper function that mutates the request and appends data and file if found.<br/><br/>1<br/><br/>import \{ addDataAndFileToRequest \} from 'payload'<br/><br/>2<br/><br/>3<br/><br/>// custom endpoint example<br/><br/>4<br/><br/>\{<br/><br/>5<br/><br/> path: '/:id/tracking',<br/><br/>6<br/><br/> method: 'post',<br/><br/>7<br/><br/>handler: async (req) \=> \{<br/><br/>8<br/><br/>await addDataAndFileToRequest(req)<br/><br/>9<br/><br/>await req.payload.update(\{<br/><br/>10<br/><br/> collection: 'tracking',<br/><br/>11<br/><br/> data: \{<br/><br/>12<br/><br/>// data to update the document with<br/><br/>13<br/><br/>\}<br/><br/>14<br/><br/>\})<br/><br/>15<br/><br/>return Response.json(\{<br/><br/>16<br/><br/> message: 'successfully updated tracking info'<br/><br/>17<br/><br/>\})<br/><br/>18<br/><br/>\}<br/><br/>19<br/><br/>\}<br/><br/>`req.locale` & `req.fallbackLocale`<br/><br/>The locale and the fallback locale are not automatically appended to custom endpoint requests. If you would like to add them you can use this helper function.<br/><br/>1<br/><br/>import \{ addLocalesToRequestFromData \} from 'payload'<br/><br/>2<br/><br/>3<br/><br/>// custom endpoint example<br/><br/>4<br/><br/>\{<br/><br/>5<br/><br/> path: '/:id/tracking',<br/><br/>6<br/><br/> method: 'post',<br/><br/>7<br/><br/>handler: async (req) \=> \{<br/><br/>8<br/><br/>await addLocalesToRequestFromData(req)<br/><br/>9<br/><br/>// you now can access req.locale & req.fallbackLocale<br/><br/>10<br/><br/>return Response.json(\{ message: 'success' \})<br/><br/>11<br/><br/>\}<br/><br/>12<br/><br/>\}<br/><br/>`headersWithCors`<br/><br/>By default, custom endpoints don't handle CORS headers in responses. The `headersWithCors` function checks the Payload config and sets the appropriate CORS headers in the response accordingly.<br/><br/>1<br/><br/>import \{ headersWithCors \} from 'payload'<br/><br/>2<br/><br/>3<br/><br/>// custom endpoint example<br/><br/>4<br/><br/>\{<br/><br/>5<br/><br/> path: '/:id/tracking',<br/><br/>6<br/><br/> method: 'post',<br/><br/>7<br/><br/>handler: async (req) \=> \{<br/><br/>8<br/><br/>return Response.json(<br/><br/>9<br/><br/>\{ message: 'success' \},<br/><br/>10<br/><br/>\{<br/><br/>11<br/><br/> headers: headersWithCors(\{<br/><br/>12<br/><br/> headers: new Headers(),<br/><br/>13<br/><br/> req,<br/><br/>14<br/><br/>\})<br/><br/>15<br/><br/>\},<br/><br/>16<br/><br/>)<br/><br/>17<br/><br/>\}<br/><br/>18<br/><br/>\}<br/><br/>Method Override for GET Requests<br/><br/>Payload supports a method override feature that allows you to send GET requests using the HTTP POST method. This can be particularly useful in scenarios when the query string in a regular GET request is too long.<br/><br/>How to Use<br/><br/>To use this feature, include the `X-HTTP-Method-Override` header set to `GET` in your POST request. The parameters should be sent in the body of the request with the `Content-Type` set to `application/x-www-form-urlencoded`.<br/><br/>Example<br/><br/>Here is an example of how to use the method override to perform a GET request:<br/><br/>Using Method Override (POST)<br/><br/>1<br/><br/>const res \= await fetch(\`$\{api\}/$\{collectionSlug\}\`, \{<br/><br/>2<br/><br/> method: 'POST',<br/><br/>3<br/><br/> credentials: 'include',<br/><br/>4<br/><br/> headers: \{<br/><br/>5<br/><br/>'Accept-Language': i18n.language,<br/><br/>6<br/><br/>'Content-Type': 'application/x-www-form-urlencoded',<br/><br/>7<br/><br/>'X-HTTP-Method-Override': 'GET',<br/><br/>8<br/><br/>\},<br/><br/>9<br/><br/> body: qs.stringify(\{<br/><br/>10<br/><br/> depth: 1,<br/><br/>11<br/><br/> locale: 'en',<br/><br/>12<br/><br/>\}),<br/><br/>13<br/><br/>\})<br/><br/>Equivalent Regular GET Request<br/><br/>1<br/><br/>const res \= await fetch(\`$\{api\}/$\{collectionSlug\}?depth=1&locale=en\`, \{<br/><br/>2<br/><br/> method: 'GET',<br/><br/>3<br/><br/> credentials: 'include',<br/><br/>4<br/><br/> headers: \{<br/><br/>5<br/><br/>'Accept-Language': i18n.language,<br/><br/>6<br/><br/>\},<br/><br/>7<br/><br/>\})<br/><br/>Next GraphQL Overview<br/><br/>###### On this page<br/><br/>* Collections<br/>* Auth Operations<br/>* Globals<br/>* Preferences<br/>* Custom Endpoints<br/>* Method Override for GET Requests<br/>* How to Use<br/>* Example<br/><br/>Star on GitHubStarChat on DiscordDiscord online<br/><br/>Edit this page on GitHub <br/><br/>Use Cases<br/><br/>Content Management SystemEnterprise App BuilderHeadless E-CommerceDigital Asset Management<br/><br/>Developers<br/><br/>Payload CloudDocumentationCommunity HelpRoadmapTemplatesReleases<br/><br/>Company<br/><br/>PricingEnterpriseCase StudiesPartner With UsFind a PartnerBlogSecurityCompare PayloadTerms of ServicePrivacy PolicyContact<br/><br/>Stay connected<br/><br/>Subscribe to our newsletterSubmit<br/><br/>Switch themesAutoLightDark |
